result.execSummary:
The defendant Antoine Alston was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

of Representation

Defendant Antoine Alston in court with attorney Ashley Jade Morse.  Mary Elizabeth Bricco appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant pleads no contest to counts 1 and 2. Court finds defendant guilty of counts 1 and 2. Court orders 9 months jail each count concurrent and concurrent with 15CT353 and 17CM1083 with full huber. In lieu of costs 12 days jail concurrent with 9 month sentence. Sentence credit 22 days.

Defendant Antoine Alston in court with attorney Matthew Lantta.  Richard Jay Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant stands mute, not guilty plea entered by court.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 8, 2018 at 01:15 pm.
